page.title: 01Introdution To Braydon Area
page.content: This is a country area extending from the western edge of the village of Purton to Braydon. Much of the land is farmland, notably used for dairy farming and grazing. The main housing communities are in Pavenhill, Restrop, Greenhill and Braydon. These are well established communities, many people having lived there all their lives. Public transport is limited. There is an hourly bus service to Swindon from Purton. The railway station and bus station are in Swindon. The roads, although narrow are well maintained. Shopping facilities are to be found in Purton along with primary and secondary schools, the library and the doctors surgery. Local employment revolves around the farms and several small local industries linked with the land.
